short_summary: Replace 16 windows and 2 doors at the Parks Canada Office in Aulavik National Park
description: Replace 16 windows and 2 door s at the Parks Canada Office in Aulavik National Park. The scope of work includes replacement of windows and doors as per the drawings around the full perimeter of the building, patching, repairing, and repainting of interior walls that are impacted. There is also work on millwork refurbishment, new flooring, and some additional painting.
full_summary:
# Stage 2 - Panikpak Window & Door Replacement, Aulavik National Park

## Tender Information

* **Reference Number:** cb-6386-94729285
* **Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0069/A
* **Publication Date:** June 13, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** June 27, 2023 at 16:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** June 30, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** October 31, 2023

## Tender Status

The tender is closed and has been marked as expired.

## Description of Requirements

Parks Canada is seeking a contractor to replace sixteen windows and two doors at the Panikpak Office building located in Aulavik National Park, Sachs Harbour. The scope of work includes:

* Replacement of windows and doors as per drawings around the full perimeter of the building
* Patching and repairing of interior walls
* Refurbishment of millwork
* New flooring installation
* Additional painting

## Requirements and Evaluation Criteria

A two-stage selection process was used to evaluate interested suppliers. This posting is for the second stage of this process, where qualified suppliers are invited to provide a financial bid based on the specifications and drawings. The procurement method used is competitive and selective.

## Notice and Attachment

This notice is for informational purposes only. The accompanying attachment is not available at this time.

## Contact Information

For any inquiries or questions, please contact Ken Lacanilao at (587) 832-1894 or kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca.

## General Terms and Conditions

The procurement and award process for this contract are governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and subject to all the terms and conditions of the contract. Only qualified suppliers who have submitted a complete and compliant bid will be considered for the contract. Parks Canada reserves the right to accept or reject any bid in whole or in part, at any time.
